attributes.additional_details: Help save the exceptional setting of Grade 1 listed Savay Farm in Buckinghamshire from the threat of HS2.  The Government has proposed a 2 1/4 mile viaduct over the lake next to the ancient house and within 250 yards.  Savay Farm dates from 1175 and there was a house on the site before this.  Henry VIII used it as a hunting lodge.  It is part of our Heritage and needs preserving.
